alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Highland; Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN BROWN, NORTHWESTERN ADAMS, NORTHWESTERN PIKE, HIGHLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 125 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Belfast, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Greenfield, Leesburg, Marshall, Bainbridge, Kincaid Springs, Belfast, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Cynthiana, New Market, Emerald, Mowrystown, South Salem, Sinking Spring, East Monroe, Samantha, May Hill, Berrysville and State Route 136 at US Route 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
